Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 14.3 and σ = 0.1. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 15% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 13.6773
* 13.7086
* 14.1964
* 14.3924

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 13.6773: Incorrect
* 13.7086: Incorrect
* 14.1964: Correct
* 14.3924: Incorrect
